feature.name: Martial Archetype: Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret)
feature.text: Purple Dragon Knights are warriors who hail from the kingdom of Cormyr. Pledged to protect the crown, they take the fight against evil beyond the kingdom's borders. They are tasked with wandering the land as knights errant, relying on their judgment, bravery, and fidelity to guide them in defeating evildoers.

A Purple Dragon Knight inspires greatness in others by committing brave deeds in battle. The mere presence of a knight in a hamlet is enough to cause some orcs and bandits to seek easier prey. A lone knight is a skilled warrior, but a knight leading a band of allies can transform even the most poorly equipped militia into a ferocious war band.
A knight prefers to lead through deeds, not words. As a knight spearheads an attack, the knight's actions can awaken reserves of courage and conviction in allies that they never suspected they had.
Source: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 128

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret): Rallying Cry
feature.text: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn how to inspire your allies to fight on past their injuries.

When you use your Second Wind feature, you can choose up to three creatures within 60 feet of you that are allied with you. Each one regains hit points equal to your fighter level, provided that the creature can see or hear you.
Source: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 128

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret): Restriction: Knighthood
feature.text: Purple Dragon Knights are tied to a specific order of Cormyrean knighthood.
Banneret serves as the generic name for this archetype if you use it in other campaign settings or to model warlords other than the Purple Dragon Knights.
Source: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 128

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret): Royal Envoy
feature.text: A Purple Dragon Knight serves as an envoy of the Cormyrean crown. Knights of high standing are expected to conduct themselves with grace.

At 7th level, you gain proficiency in the Persuasion skill. If you are already proficient in it, you gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Insight, Intimidation, or Performance.
Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses Persuasion. You receive this benefit regardless of the skill proficiency you gain from this feature.
Source: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 128

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret): Inspiring Surge
feature.text: Starting at 10th level, when you use your Action Surge feature, you can choose one creature within 60 feet of you that is allied with you. That creature can make one melee or ranged weapon attack with its reaction, provided that it can see or hear you.
Starting at 18th level, you can choose two allies within 60 feet of you, rather than one.
Source: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 128

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret): Bulwark
feature.text: Beginning at 15th level, you can extend the benefit of your Indomitable feature to an ally. When you decide to use Indomitable to reroll an Intelligence, a Wisdom, or a Charisma saving throw and you aren't incapacitated, you can choose one ally within 60 feet of you that also failed its saving throw against the same effect. If that creature can see or hear you, it can reroll its saving throw and must use the new roll.
Source: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 128

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Purple Dragon Knight (Banneret): Inspiring Surge
feature.text: Starting at 18th level, you can choose two allies within 60 feet of you, rather than one.
Source: Sword Coast Adventurer's Guide p. 128

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque
feature.text: The archetypical is a master of ranged combat. It doesn't matter if you are engaging a foe with a bow, a thrown dagger or a net, you are able to push the limits of what is possible with any ranged weapon. Your training and education has made you the pinnacle of distanced fighting and you can rain down devastating blows.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Combat Archer
feature.text: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you master several ranged combat skills. Engaging hostile creatures in close combat or behind cover is not an issue for an, nor is reloading a crossbow to achieve a higher rate of fire.
You ignore disadvantage on ranged weapon attack rolls when a hostile creature is within 5 feet of you.
You ignore the loading quality of crossbows with which you are proficient.
Your ranged and thrown weapon attacks ignore half cover and three-quarters cover.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Weapon Smith
feature.text: Starting at 3rd level, you can make modifications to your ranged and thrown weapons. These modifications make the weapons more effective in your hands. A weapon can only benefit from one modification at a time.
You gain the bow makers tool proficiency.
You get extra performance from any ranged weapon that you customize. Customizing an item requires you to spend a short rest making modifications to it.
Once you complete this customization, you can do one of the following.
· Add the finesse property to the customized item if it doesn't have it.
· Remove the heavy condition if the customized item has it.
· Add a +1 to damage rolls.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Trick Shot
feature.text: When you choose this archetype at 3rd level, you learn trick shots that are fueled by special dice called superiority dice.
Trick Shots: You learn three trick shots of your choice. Many trick shots enhance an attack in some way. You can use only one trick shot per attack.
You learn two additional trick shots of your choice at 7th, 10th, and 15th level. Each time you learn new trick shots, you can also replace one trick shot you know with a different one.
Superiority Dice: You have four superiority dice, which are d8s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
You gain another superiority die at 7th level and one more at 15th level.
Saving Throws: Some of your trick shots require your target to make a saving throw to resist the trick shot's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:
Trick Shot save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + Strngth or Dexterity modifier (your choice).
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Find The Weak Spot
feature.text: Starting at 7th level, you are exceptionaly good at finding the weak spot in an enemy's defenses.
Before you make an attack with a ranged or thrown weapon that you are proficient with, you can choose to take a -5 penalty to the attack roll. If the attack hits, you add +10 to the attack's damage.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Additional Trick Shots
feature.text: At 7th level, you learn two additional Trick Shots.
Each time you learn new trick shots, you can also replace one trick shot you know with a different one.
Superiority Dice: You have five superiority dice, which are d8s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Additional Trick Shots
feature.text: At 10th level, you learn two additional Trick Shots.
Each time you learn new trick shots, you can also replace one trick shot you know with a different one.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Range Master
feature.text: Starting at 10th level, the normal range for any ranged or thrown weapon that you are proficient in is doubled. The long range remains the same.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Additional Trick Shots
feature.text: At 15th level, you learn two additional Trick Shots.
Each time you learn new trick shots, you can also replace one trick shot you know with a different one.
Superiority Dice: You have six superiority dice, which are d8s. A superiority die is expended when you use it. You regain all of your expended superiority dice when you finish a short or long rest.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: Ranged Reaction
feature.text: Starting at 15th level, when a creature misses you with a ranged weapon attack, you can use your reaction to make an attack of opportunity against the attacker as long as you have a ranged weapon in your hand and the attacker is within range.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck

feature.name: Martial Archetype: Eminusque: The Impossible Shot
feature.text: At 18th level, you can make shots that no-one else can make.

When you use this feature and take the Attack action, you double the long range of any ranged or thrown weapon you are proficient with. The first successful ranged attack roll using this feature is a critical hit.
Once you use this feature you can't use it again until you complete a short or long rest.
Source: Custom subclass in World of Koreth, OneNote * Warren Fischbeck
